Oct 20, 2021
</div>
<div class="post-comments">

</div>
<h1 class="post-title">
<span class="the-title">What is the “Global Public-Private Partnership”?</span> </h1>
<div class="post-author">
<a href="https://off-guardian.org/author/admin/" title="All posts by Editor">Editor</a> </div>
</div>
<div class="post_page-content post">
<h6>Iain Davis</h6>
<div class="wp-caption aligncenter" id="attachment_78744" style="width: 2010px"><a href="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/wef-un-joint-agreement.jpg?x46269"><img alt="" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-78744" class="size-offg-header-image-2 wp-image-78744" decoding="async" height="900" src="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/wef-un-joint-agreement-2000x900.jpg?x46269" width="2000"/></a><p class="wp-caption-text" id="caption-attachment-78744">Heads of UN and WEF signing “strategic partnership framework”, New York 2019</p></div>
<h3 style="font-size: 150%; margin-bottom: 0;">Audio Version <span style="color: RGB(150,0,50)"><sup>New Feature!</sup></span></h3>
<div class="audio-container" style="margin-top: 0.5rem;">
<!--[if lt IE 9]><script>document.createElement('audio');</script><![endif]-->
<audio class="wp-audio-shortcode" controls="controls" id="audio-78733-1" preload="none" style="width: 100%;"><source src="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/What-is-the-global-public-private-partnership-Edit-1.mp3?_=1" type="audio/mpeg"/><a href="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/What-is-the-global-public-private-partnership-Edit-1.mp3">https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/What-is-the-global-public-private-partnership-Edit-1.mp3</a></audio></div>
<p class="dropcap">The Global Public-Private Partnership (GPPP) is a world-wide network of <a href="https://archive.is/RxOdK" rel="noopener" target="_blank">stakeholder capitalists</a> and their partners.</p>
<p>This collective of stakeholders (the capitalists and their partners) comprises global corporations (including central banks), philanthropic foundations (multi-billionaire philanthropists), policy think-tanks, governments (and their agencies), non-governmental organisations, selected academic &amp; scientific institutions, global charities, the labour unions and other chosen <em>“thought leaders.”</em></p>
<p>The GPPP controls global finance and the world’s economy. It sets world, national and local policy (via global governance) and then promotes those policies using the mainstream media (MSM) corporations who are also <em>“partners”</em> within the GPPP.</p>
<p>Often those policies are devised by the think-tanks before being adopted by governments, who are also GPPP <em>partners</em>. Government is the process of transforming GPPP global <em>governance</em> into hard policy, legislation and law.</p>
<p>Under our current model of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Westphalian_sovereignty" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Westphalian national sovereignty</a>, the government of one nation cannot make legislation or law in another. However, through <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_governance" rel="noopener" target="_blank">global governance</a>, the GPPP create policy initiatives at the global level which then cascade down to people in every nation. This typically occurs via an intermediary policy distributor, such as the IMF or IPCC, and national government then enact the <em>recommended</em> policies.</p>
<p>The policy trajectory is set internationally by the authorised definition of problems and their prescribed solutions. Once the GPPP enforce the consensus internationally, the policy framework is set. The GPPP stakeholder partners then collaborate to ensure the desired policies are developed, implemented and enforced. This is the oft quoted <em>“international rules based system.”  </em></p>
<p>In this way the GPPP control many nations at once without having to resort to legislation. This has the added advantage of making any legal challenge to the decisions made by the most senior <em>partners</em> in the GPPP (it is an authoritarian hierarchy) extremely difficult.</p>
<div class="wp-caption aligncenter" id="attachment_78735" style="width: 660px"><a href="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/GPPP.png?x46269" rel="noopener" target="_blank"><img alt="" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-78735" class="size-offg-body-image-650 wp-image-78735" decoding="async" height="366" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px" src="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/GPPP-650x366.png?x46269" srcset="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/GPPP-650x366.png 650w, https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/GPPP-500x281.png 500w, https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/GPPP-1400x788.png 1400w, https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/GPPP-768x432.png 768w, https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/GPPP-1536x864.png 1536w, https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/GPPP-800x450.png 800w, https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/GPPP.png 1920w" width="650"/></a><p class="wp-caption-text" id="caption-attachment-78735">[click to enlarge]</p></div>
<p>The GPPP has traditionally been referenced in the context of public health and specifically in a number of United Nation’s (UN) documents, including those from their agencies such as the <a href="https://in-this-together.com/Wdh4hd/GHG.pdf?x38956" rel="noopener" target="_blank">World Health Organisation</a> (WHO). </p>
<p>In their 2005 document <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210403084237/https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/43385/9241593903_eng.pdf?sequence=1&amp;isAllowed=y" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Connecting For Health</a>, the WHO, in noting what the Millennium Development Goals meant for global health, revealed the emerging GPPP:</p>
<blockquote><p>These changes occurred in a world of revised expectations about the role of government: that the public sector has neither the financial nor the institutional resources to meet their challenges, and that a mix of public and private resources is required……Building a global culture of security and cooperation is vital….The beginnings of a global health infrastructure are already in place. Information and communication technologies have opened opportunities for change in health, with or without policy-makers leading the way…….Governments can create an enabling environment, and invest in equity, access and innovation.”</p></blockquote>
<p>The <em>revised role</em> of governments meant that they were no longer <em>leading the way</em>. The traditional policymakers weren’t making policy anymore, other GPPP partners were. National government had been relegated to creating the GPPP’s <em>enabling environment</em> by taxing the public and increasing government borrowing debt.</p>
<p>This is a debt owed to the senior partners in the GPPP. They are also the beneficiaries of the loans and use this comically misnamed <em>“public investment”</em> to create markets for themselves and the wider the GPPP.</p>
<p>The researchers <a href="https://in-this-together.com/UKC/PHGPPP.pdf?x38956" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Buse &amp; Walt 2000</a> offers a good <em>official</em> history of the development of the GPPP concept. They suggest it was a response to the growing disillusionment in the UN project as a whole and the emerging realisation that global corporations were increasingly key to policy implementation. This correlates to the development of the stakeholder capitalism concept, first popularised in the 1970s.</p>
<p>Buse &amp; Walt outlined how GPPP’s were designed to facilitate the participation of new breed of corporations. These entities had recognised the folly of their previously destructive business practices. They were ready to own their mistakes and make amends. They decided they would achieve this by <em>partnering</em> with government to solve global problems. These existential threats were defined by the GPPP and the selected scientists, academics and economists they funded.</p>
<p>The two researchers identified a <a href="https://www.un.org/press/en/1998/19980130.SGSM6448.html" rel="noopener" target="_blank">key Davos address</a>, delivered by then UN Secretary General Kofi Annan to the WEF in 1998, as marking the transition to a GPPP based global governance model:</p>
<blockquote><p>The United Nations has been transformed since we last met here in Davos. The Organization has undergone a complete overhaul that I have described as a ‘quiet revolution’…A fundamental shift has occurred. The United Nations once dealt only with governments. By now we know that peace and prosperity cannot be achieved without partnerships involving governments, international organizations, the business community and civil society…The business of the United Nations involves the businesses of the world.”</p></blockquote>
<p>Buse &amp; Walt claimed that this signified the arrival of a new type of <em>responsible global capitalism.</em> As we shall see, that is not how the corporations viewed this arrangement. Indeed, Buse and Walt acknowledged why the GPPP was such an enticing prospect for the global giants of banking, industry, finance and commerce:</p>
<blockquote><p>Shifting ideologies and trends in globalization have highlighted the need for closer global governance, an issue for both private and public sectors. We suggest that at least some of the support for GPPPs stems from this recognition, and a desire on the part of the private sector to be part of global regulatory decision-making processes.”</p></blockquote>
<p>The conflict of interest is obvious. We are simply expected to accept, without question, that global corporations are committed to putting humanitarian and environmental causes before profit. Supposedly, a GPPP led system of global governance is somehow beneficial for us.</p>
<p>Believing this requires a considerable degree of naivety. Many of the stakeholder corporations have been convicted, or publicly held accountable, <a href="https://archives.fbi.gov/archives/news/stories/2009/september/pfizer_settlement_090209" rel="noopener" target="_blank">for the crimes they have commited</a>. These include <a href="https://archive.is/WiduA" rel="noopener" target="_blank">war crimes</a>. The apparent passive agreement of the political class that these <em>“partners”</em> should effectively set global policy, regulations and spending priorities seems like infantile credulity.</p>
<p>This naivety is, in itself, a charade. As many academics, economists, historians and researchers <a href="https://in-this-together.com/who-are-the-new-world-order-a-brief-history/">have pointed out</a>, corporate influence, even dominance of the political system had been increasing for generations. Elected politicians have long-been the junior partners in this arrangement.</p>
<p>With the arrival of GPPP’s we were witnessing the birth of the process to formalise this relationship, the creation of a cohesive world order. The politicians have simply stuck to the script ever since. They didn’t write it.</p>
<p>It is important to understand the difference between <em>government</em> and <em>governance</em> in the global context. Government claims the right, perhaps through a quasi-democratic mandate, to set policy and decree legislation (law.)</p>
<p>The alleged western representative democracies, which aren’t <a href="https://in-this-together.com/the-british-constitution-deception-part-1/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">democracies at all</a>, are a model of national government where elected representatives form the executive who enact legislation. For example, in the UK this is achieved through the parliamentary process.</p>
<p>Perhaps the closest thing to this form of national government on an international scale is the <a href="https://www.abacademies.org/articles/the-role-of-general-assembly-resolutions-to-the-development-of-international-law-10426.html" rel="noopener" target="_blank">United Nations General Assembly</a>. It has a tenuous claim to democratic accountability and can pass <em>resolutions</em> which, while they don’t bind member states, can create <em>“new principles”</em> which may become international law when later applied by the International Court of Justice.</p>
<p>However, this isn’t really world <em>“government.”</em> The UN lacks the authority to decree legislation and form law. The only way its <em>“principles”</em> can become law is via judicial ruling. The non-judicial power to create law is reserved for governments and their legislative reach only extends to their own national borders.</p>
<p>Due to the often fraught relationships between national governments, world <em>government</em> starts to become impractical. With both the non-binding nature of UN resolutions and the international jockeying for geopolitical and economic advantage, there isn’t currently anything we could call a <em>world government</em>.</p>
<p>There is the additional problem of national and cultural identity. Most populations aren’t ready for a distant, unelected world government. People generally want the political class to have more democratic accountability, not less.</p>
<p>The GPPP would certainly like to run a world government, but imposition by overt force is beyond their capability. Therefore, they have employed other means, such as deception and propaganda, to promote the notion of <em>global governance</em>.</p>
<p>Former Carter administration advisor and Trilateral Commission founder Zbigniew Brzezinski recognised how this approach would be easier to implement. In his 1970 book <a href="https://ia800208.us.archive.org/13/items/books_201603/between_twoages.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank"><em>Between Two Ages: Americas Role In The Technetronic Era</em></a>, he wrote:</p>
<blockquote><p>Though the objective of shaping a community of the developed nations is less ambitious than the goal of world government, it is more attainable.”</p></blockquote>
<p>The last 30 years have seen numerous GPPP’s form as the concept of global governance has evolved. A major turning point was the WEF’s conspectus of <em>multistakeholder governance</em>. With their 2010 publication of <a href="http://www3.weforum.org/docs/WEF_GRI_EverybodysBusiness_Report_2010.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Everybody’s Business: Strengthening International Cooperation in a More Interdependent World</a>, the WEF outlined the elements of GPPP stakeholder’s form of global governance.</p>
<p>They established their <em>Global Agenda Councils</em> to deliberate and suggest policy covering practically every aspect of our existence. The WEF created a corresponding <em>global governance</em> body for every aspect of our society. From our values and economy, through to our security and public health, our welfare systems, consumption, access to water, food security, crime, our rights, sustainable development and the global financial and monetary system, nothing was left untouched.</p>
<p>The executive chairman of the WEF, Klaus Schwab, spelled out what the objective of <em>global governance</em> was:</p>
<div class="transcript">
<p>Our purpose has been to stimulate a strategic thought process among all stakeholders about ways in which international institutions and arrangements should be adapted to contemporary challenges…the world’s leading authorities have been working in interdisciplinary, multistakeholder Global Agenda Councils to identify gaps and deficiencies in international cooperation and to formulate specific proposals for improvement…</p>
<p>These discussions have run through the Forum’s Regional Summits during 2009 as well as the Forum’s recent Annual Meeting 2010 in Davos-Klosters, where many of the emerging proposals were tested with ministers, CEOs, heads of NGOs and trade unions, leading academics and other members of the Davos community…</p>
<p>The Global Redesign process has provided an informal working laboratory or marketplace for a number of good policy ideas and partnership opportunities…We have sought to expand international governance discussions…to take more pre-emptive and coordinated action on the full range of risks that have been accumulating in the international system.
</p></div>
<p>By 2010 the WEF had taken it upon themselves to begin the <em> Global Redesign</em> process. They defined the international challenges and they proposed the solutions. Fortunately for the GPPP, their <em>proposals</em> meant more control and partnership opportunities for them. The WEF sought to spearhead the expansion of this <em>international governance</em>.</p>
<p>In just one example, in 2019 the UK Government announced its <a href="https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-and-world-economic-forum-to-lead-regulation-revolution-to-foster-industries-of-the-future" rel="noopener" target="_blank">partnership with the WEF</a> to develop future business, economic and industrial regulations. The UK government were committed to supporting a regulatory environment created by the global corporations who would then be regulated by the same regulations they had designed.</p>
<p>The WEF do not have an electoral mandate of any kind. None of us have any opportunity to influence or even question their judgments and yet they are working <em>in partnership</em> with our supposedly democratically elected governments, and other GPPP stakeholders, to redesign the planet we all live on.</p>
<p>Stakeholder capitalism lies at the heart of the GPPP. Essentially it usurps democratic government (or indeed government of any kind) by placing global corporations at the centre of decision making. Despite deriving authority from no one but themselves, the leaders of the GPPP assume their own modern interpretation of the “<em><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Divine_right_of_kings" rel="noopener" target="_blank">divine right of kings</a></em>” and rule absolutely.</p>
<p>In January 2021 The WEF spoke about how they viewed <a href="https://archive.is/RxOdK" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Stakeholder Capitalism</a>:</p>
<blockquote><p>The most important characteristic of the stakeholder model today is that the stakes of our system are now more clearly global.. What was once seen as externalities in national economic policy making and individual corporate decision making will now need to be incorporated or internalized in the operations of every government, company, community, and individual. The planet is.. the center of the global economic system, and its health should be optimized in the decisions made by all other stakeholders.”</p></blockquote>
<p>The GPPP will oversee everything. Every government, all business, our so-called communities (where we live) and each of us individually. We are not the priority. The priority is the planet. Or so the WEF claim.</p>
<p>Centralised control of the entire planet, all its resources and everyone that lives on it is the core ethos of the GPPP. There is no need to <em>interpret</em> GPPP intentions, we don’t have to<em> read between the lines</em>. It is stated plainly in the introduction to the <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20211002091025/https://www.weforum.org/great-reset" rel="noopener" target="_blank">WEF’s Great Reset</a> initiative:</p>
<blockquote><p>To improve the state of the world, the World Economic Forum is starting The Great Reset initiative.. The Covid-19 crisis.. is fundamentally changing the traditional context for decision-making. The inconsistencies, inadequacies and contradictions of multiple systems –from health and financial to energy and education – are more exposed than ever.. Leaders find themselves at a historic crossroads.. As we enter a unique window of opportunity to shape the recovery, this initiative will offer insights to help inform all those determining the future state of global relations, the direction of national economies, the priorities of societies, the nature of business models and the management of a global commons.”</p></blockquote>
<p>It should be noted that the WEF are just one partner organisation among many in the GPPP. However, they have been perhaps the most influential in terms of <a href="https://in-this-together.com/bernays-the-danger-of-public-relations/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">public relations</a> throughout the <a href="https://in-this-together.com/pseudopandemic/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">pseudopandemic</a>. Contrary to the hopes of Buse &amp; Walt, we see an emergent global, corporate dictatorship, not caring stewardship of the planet.</p>
<p>The GPPP will determine <em>the future state of global relations, the direction of national economies, the priorities of societies, the nature of business models and the management of a global commons</em>. There is no opportunity for any of us to participate in either their project or the subsequent formation of policy.</p>
<a href="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/STakeholderCapitalism.png?x46269"><img alt="" class="aligncenter size-offg-body-image-650 wp-image-78737" decoding="async" height="644" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px" src="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/STakeholderCapitalism-650x644.png?x46269" srcset="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/STakeholderCapitalism-650x644.png 650w, https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/STakeholderCapitalism-500x495.png 500w, https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/STakeholderCapitalism-150x150.png 150w, https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/STakeholderCapitalism.png 660w" width="650"/></a>
<p>While, in theory, governments do not have to implement GPPP policy, the reality is that they do. Global policies have been an increasing facet of our lives in the post WW2 era. The mechanism of translating GPPP policy initiatives, first into national and then regional and eventually local policy, can be clearly identified by looking at sustainable development.</p>
<p>In 1972 the <a href="https://thetechnocratictyranny.com/PDFS/Clubofrome_dossiers.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">privately funded</a>, independent policy think-tank the Club of Rome (CoR) published <a href="https://www.clubofrome.org/publication/the-limits-to-growth/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">the Limits of Growth</a>. As we saw with the roll-out out of the <em><a href="https://in-this-together.com/pseudopandemic/">pseudopandemic</a>,</em> the CoR used computer models to predict what they decreed were the complex problems faced by the entire planet: the <em>“world problematique.”</em></p>
<p>Their offered opinions derived from the commissioned work of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology’s (MIT’s) system dynamic <em>“World3 model.”</em> This assumed global population would deplete natural resources and pollute the environment to the point where <em>“overshoot and collapse”</em> would inevitably occur.</p>
<p>This is not a scientific <em>“fact”</em> but rather a suggested scenario. So far, none of the predictions made have come to pass.</p>
<p>The scientific and statistical to-and-fro on the claims made in the Limits to Growth <a href="https://www.corbettreport.com/limitstogrowth/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">has been prolific</a>. However, ignoring all doubts, the <em>World3</em> model was firmly planted at the centre of the sustainable development policy environment.</p>
<p>In 1983 the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brundtland_Commission" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Brundtland Commission</a> was convened by former Norwegian Prime Minister Gro Harland Brundlandt and then Secretary General of the UN Javier Pérez de Cuéllar. Both were Club of Rome members. Based upon the highly questionable assumptions in the World3 model, they set about uniting governments from around the world to pursue sustainable development policies.</p>
<p>In 1987 the Commission published the Brundtland Report, also known as <a href="https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Brundtland_Report" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Our Common Future</a>. Central to the idea of sustainable development, outlined in the report, was population control (reduction.)  This policy decision, to get rid of people, won international acclaim and awards for the authors.</p>
<p>The underlying assumptions for these policy proposals weren’t publicly challenged at all. The academic and scientific debate raged but remained almost completely unreported. As far as the public knew, scientific assumption and speculation was a proven fact. It is now impossible to question these unproven assumptions and obviously inaccurate models without being accused of <em>“climate denial.”</em></p>
<p>This resulted in the Millenium Development Goals and eventually, in 2015, they gave way to the United Nation’s full adoption of <a href="https://unevoc.unesco.org/home/Adoption+of+the+Sustainable+Development+Goals" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Sustainable Development Goals</a> (SDGs), In turn, these have been translated into government policy. For example, the UK government proudly announced their <a href="https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-becomes-first-major-economy-to-pass-net-zero-emissions-law" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Net Zero policy commitment</a> to sustainable development goals in 2019.</p>
<p>SDGs were already making an impact at the regional and local level in counties, cities, towns and boroughs across the UK. Nearly every council across the country has a “<a href="https://www.portsmouth.gov.uk/services/council-and-democracy/policies-and-strategies/creating-sustainable-communities/" rel="noopener" target="_blank"><em>sustainable development plan</em></a>.”</p>
<p>Regardless of what you think about the global threats we may or may not face, the origin and the distribution pathway of the resultant policy is clear. A privately funded, globalist think-tank was the driver of a policy agenda which led to the creation of a global policy framework, adopted by governments the world over, which has impacted communities in nearly every corner of the Earth.</p>
<p>SDGs are just one among numerous examples of GPPP <em>global governance</em> in action. The elected politician’s role in this process is negligible. They merely serve to implement and sell the policy to the public.</p>
<p>It doesn’t matter who you elect, the policy trajectory is set at the global governance level. This is the dictatorial nature of the GPPP and nothing could be less <em>democratic</em>.</p>
<h6>You can read more of Iain’s work at his blog <a href="https://in-this-together.com/anti-rationalist/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">In This Together</a> or on <a href="https://www.ukcolumn.org/writer/iain-davis" rel="noopener" target="_blank">UK Column</a> or follow him on <a href="https://twitter.com/_InThisTogether" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Twitter</a>. His new book <em>Pseudopandemic</em>, is now available, in both in kindle and paperback, from <a href="https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B097CZ3K7K" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Amazon</a> and other sellers. Or you can claim a free copy by <a href="https://in-this-together.com/books/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">subscribing to his newsletter</a>.</h6>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>This is an excellent expose and breakdown that provides key details and structure, and builds nicely on Rosa Koire’s work (see her book Behind the Green Mask). Iain, I would like to know where the Impact Management Project fits into this structure. They are 2000 of the world’s largest asset holders who are waiting with bated breath to run their capital through our bodies once the biosecurity state, Internet of Things, the Internet of Bodies sensors are fully functional. See who they are on their website and read about Impact Investing below: </p>

<li><a href="https://impactmanagementproject.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">https://impactmanagementproject.com/</a></li>

</ul>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>I don’t think “most will be begging for control and order again”.<br/>
Most of those who would beg for order and control will be the first victims to go. Also, their storm troopers will still be outnumbered by a 1000 to 1, and they will likely end up like the Ukrainian suicide army is now.<br/>
Hired mercenaries won’t work out too well either.</p>
</div>

I always believe that we have and are being told what is happening; because our “transference just be voluntary” (JUST MY VIEW); they can get to most of us via films / TV / MSM.. anyway, if my opinion is worth anything; watch “World War Z” … Z a letter that does not exist in Russian, but is everywhere, watch that old film contagion – remember a ship blocking the Suez canal, with Evergreen on (skip to the film until you see the shipping yard) and here is my favourite … a film called “Surrogates” – with Bruce Willis. <div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442951"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Iain did a good job, but he stays bounded with zeitgeist, that is well described with the term Capitalist Realism (Mark Fischer).</p>
<p>Confucius has been asked by disciple: “What would be your first move if you would work for emperor?”<br/>
He said: ” First I would rectify Names”. (words == names for things)<br/>
From this exchange the following “quote” is derived (translation, transposition):<br/>
“When words lose their meaning people lose their freedom”</p>
<p>Look at the language “elites” are using. It’s not meant to reveal things, but to deceive and hide.<br/>
Lets rectify a name, lets gain some freedom…<br/>
Stakeholder Capitalism—&gt;&gt;&gt;Monopoly Capitalism.<br/>
Disagree??? Check this out.<br/>
<a href="https://odysee.com/@Turricano:5/Monopoly-Who_Owns_The_World:9" rel="noopener nofollow ugc" target="_blank">https://odysee.com/@Turricano:5/Monopoly-Who_Owns_The_World:9</a></p>
<p>It’s not about you owning nothing (and bs happiness), it’s about they now own almost Everything. They effectively own the World. Since the World is effectively their property they are managing/administering/governing Their Stuff like every good lord/master does. They can use or abuse Their Stuff to the best of their ability. This is their Right as owners, you know, Property Rights protected by every damn constitution on this upside-down world and it is so for centuries.</p>
<p>And now You would like to say, you even dare to think, what they will do with Their Stuff?????<br/>
Really????<br/>
Are you hallucinating??? (damn weed is too strong this days)<br/>
Are you Commie????</p>
<p>No, no, I’m not on their side, I just try to vividly portray the Truth that’s been forgotten in last few decades. Marx said capitalism will end with Monopoly Capitalism and here we are. This ideas/knowledge went down the drain and people now associate marxism with piles of corpses instead of the best critique of capitalism. They live Capitalist Realism, some are asleep, some analyzing capitalists moves, some go further to conspiracy facts, but in fact mostly leaves the Beast untouched.<br/>
Of course the Beast will never present things as I did, so they invented Great reset. Everything is public(well..), go research, dive in, hate them….they are perfectly fine, because you will leave roots untouched. You will be preoccupied with them and with the misery they created for you and you won’t think about ideas and concepts that enables them.<br/>
Just some iconoclasts dare to critically think about the concept of Property. Oh, yeaah… here we are. The biggest problem, might even be the only one, with the concept of Property is that it is not scalable. Namely, you owning your stuff is very different than Evil Billy owning his stuff, let alone “elites” owning the world. Size matters no matter what you’ve been told.</p>
<p>I think historians will one day named our epoch Social-Luddism.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>That is a fantastic diagram. The only thing I would add under Policy Distributors and Policy Enforcers is the European Commission.It is a bizarre totalitarian structure operating in the shadows, fronted by a toothless Parliament. The EU is really a key player in this whole thing, not least because of its geographic position between the Americas, Asia and Africa.<br/>
The vaccine passport is a European idea; they have been working on it for years.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Why do you think the vaccine passport is a European idea ?. The vaccine passport is but the start of bringing the full ID passport; to get people used to using their QR code (cannot go to a restaurant before showing it = double jabbed etc.); this is the full (ish) creature = <a href="https://id2020.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">https://id2020.org/</a> </p>
<p>… and then if you scroll down and look at the main partners, you will see it contains Microsoft, Accenture and Gavi.</p>
<p>Let us have a look at Gavi in more detail = <a href="https://www.gavi.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">https://www.gavi.org/</a></p>
<p>… gain down (quite a lot), until you come to “Our partners” and have a look at the image on the left. I just draw your attention to this page and leave it to you to have a look around if you want = <a href="https://www.gavi.org/investing-gavi/funding/donor-profiles" rel="nofollow ugc">https://www.gavi.org/investing-gavi/funding/donor-profiles</a></p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Now 6 months later, we cannot ignore the Chinese origin of the vax passports, social credit scoring, being Shanghai’d. It seems they were the original model for all of that? Taiwan is next to be Shanghai’d…</p>
<p>The public private partnerships in the US and EU are smelling and looking like classic fascism/corporatism and are obvious now too. Is GPPP just another name for fascism/corporatism/crony capitalism? It kinda smells that way.</p>

<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=I am reading Ernst Niekisch’s Da... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F20%2Fwhat-is-the-global-public-private-partnership%2F%23comment-442539" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442539"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>I am reading Ernst Niekisch’s Das Reich der niederen Dämonen about the birth of Nazism in Germany, and I was struck by his description of the ideology behind National Socialism, because it seems the same that inspired Klaus Schwab, beyond of the aesthetics of the original Nazism … Here is an excerpt from the book:<br/>
” The big bourgeoisie caressed the project of new statutory forms; medieval organisms came back to her mind, she went back to the Middle Ages; industrial feudalism appeared to her the port in which she hoped to find that social peace which allowed her the undisturbed enjoyment of her privileges: she aspired to build, within the company, that position of domination achieved by the feudal landowner in his funds .<br/>
 Industrial feudalism had once been the social recipe of Alfred Krupp and of Mr. von Strumm, from whose paternalism the National Socialist revolution had started. The worker is a minor, he has neither to express an opinion nor to fight: he has no right to demand, he must simply accept gratefully what is assigned to him, and otherwise obey.<br/>
He is a ” familiar ”, a service order will set his duties within the company; no more employment contracts resulting from negotiations. The salary assigned remains unchanged, at the minimum vital level … The freedom of movement of the worker is limited, perhaps later it will be revoked; the worker gradually expires in a state of bond with the company, corresponding to the ancient serfdom. It is a bond that annihilates him as a free individual; it no longer depends on him whether he wants to work or not: the execution of the tasks is a corvée, to which he is obliged to his feudal industrial master; refusing to work is already in contravention of the laws, it is revolt.<br/>
The feudal overlord was at the same time military leader; his court was a military entity, the infantrymen he took from his male family members … the modern industrial complex is an integral part of the war economy, it is in it that weapons are forged.<br/>
The working masses, concentrated in the workshops, says Il Manifesto dei Communisti, ” are militarily organized. These simple soldiers of industry, the workers, are subjected to the protection of a whole hierarchy of officers and non-commissioned officers. They are not only the servants of the bourgeois class, of the bourgeois state, but every day, hour by hour, they are enslaved by the machine, by the superintendent, but above all by the individual bourgeois as producer. ” They no longer receive a salary, but a “sòldus”, . In front of their car they perform military service, the order of their master becomes for them the supreme law. ”</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">
<div class="wpd-vote">

</div><div id="wpdiscuz_form_anchor-503160_442539"></div></div></div><div class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 wpd-comment wpd_comment_level-1" id="wpd-comm-442537_0"><div class="wpd-comment-wrap wpd-blog-guest">
<div class="wpd-comment-left">
<div class="wpd-avatar">
<img alt="Moneycircus" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" decoding="async" height="64" loading="lazy" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/ace2439860dc0b121f32932144925ecd?s=64&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/ace2439860dc0b121f32932144925ecd?s=128&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg 2x" width="64"/>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-442537">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
Moneycircus
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 21, 2021 6:46 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 21, 2021 6:46 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Naming The Names — Who gets the right ... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F20%2Fwhat-is-the-global-public-private-partnership%2F%23comment-442537" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442537"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p><a href="https://moneycircus.substack.com/p/naming-the-names" rel="noopener nofollow ugc" target="_blank">Naming The Names — Who gets the right to destroy you anonymously?</a><br/>
If you wonder how apparently diverse institutions began to operate in Lockstep in February of 2020: every newspaper and television station, school, university, district council, government department, company executive, non-profit or charity and every political party…</p>
<p>If you wonder how they knew just what to do — without debate, legislatures dispersed so soon. If you question where they derived their claims to authority, these run-of-the-mill functionaries who suddenly exerted official power of life and death, at least to kill your business and extinguish your child’s education… Read on.</p>
<p>Journalists tend to shy away from naming names. Not only for fear of lawsuits (Britain’s libel laws favour the complainant) but because it seems churlish to point a finger and lazy as a short-cut to explaining how the world works.</p>
<p>It is hard to avoid the faces of Covid, however: the politicians and bureaucrats who are so quick, loud and unquestioning faced with something that kills no more people than the flu. Have we accused the correct institution — did we get their names right? I suggest they have outed themselves.</p>
<p>One is the World Economic Forum (WEF) that plays a coordinating role. Its Forum of Young Global Leaders has 1,400 members and alumni from more than 120 countries. You will recognize many of them because they have been vocal leaders of Event Covid.</p>
<p><strong>The impasse</strong><br/>
<strong><em>﻿</em></strong><em>Businesses wouldn’t destroy themselves, politicians wouldn’t lay waste to their own economies</em>, I hear you say.</p>
<p>That depends on their predicament:</p>
<ul>
<li>pension crisis — governments can’t pay, won’t pay</li>
<li>banking crisis — asset bubble cannot levitate forever</li>
<li>industrial crisis — looming mass unemployment</li>
<li>energy crisis — man-made but no less real</li>
<li>pollution crisis — most toxic waste is industrial</li>
<li>corporate crisis — regulators turn a blind eye to monopoly</li>
<li>nation state crisis — corporations out-play countries</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Rivals for power</strong><br/>
This is not simply regulatory capture — in which corporations take over the government agencies that are supposed to regulate them. Social institutions have been seized: universities and the guilds from which they emerged; fraternities, business clubs and trade organizations.</p>
<p>Outcomes management is the mantra for this new orthodoxy. Control would otherwise be impossible. It allows stakeholders, owners and vested interests to get what they want. It imposes rigid conformity, a path to an outcome from which any deviation is an error. Most importantly it operates through a kind of mind control.</p>
<p>Some university lecturers today pride themselves on manufacturing activists. As this places more focus on identity politics than the reality of economic relations, I would argue this is just another elevation of process and mind-formation over sweating one’s labour in the material world.</p>
<p>Outcomes are a very real battle between vested interests, in which ideological purity or consensus of interest is seen to add weight to a decision, while lowering the perceived value of individual will and skills — which become a negative, adding to the cost and complexity of every decision. Outputs no longer drive outcomes; in fact, they are not allowed to.</p>
<p><strong>Naming names</strong><br/>
Identity politics and managed outcomes are related to a third concept much-touted nowadays: equity.</p>
<p>Perhaps there is a reason why oligarchs and billionaires promote all three. Has the corporate become ideological? Has business transformed from the generating of dollars and cents to a higher calling. Yes! In the minds of billionaires it is inevitable that they entwine identity and wealth: they invest their souls with their money, which becomes their overweening ambition. They need to believe they are deserving of their wealth — and they mean to keep it to themselves.</p>
<p>In summary, the degree of mind control that accompanies Event Covid, the Lockdown and the momentous transfer of wealth that is taking place in its shadow, makes the propaganda machine of the Third Reich look like playtime.</p>
<p><a href="https://moneycircus.substack.com/p/naming-the-names" rel="nofollow ugc">https://moneycircus.substack.com/p/naming-the-names</a></p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>
<div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-like" title="0">0</div><div class="wpd-vote-result-sep"></div><div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-dislike" title="0">0</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-left">
<div class="wpd-avatar">
<img alt="Ian" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" decoding="async" height="64" loading="lazy" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/1d763278ca5a37f099194c3ac59d75a4?s=64&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/1d763278ca5a37f099194c3ac59d75a4?s=128&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg 2x" width="64"/>

<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-442536">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
Ian
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 21, 2021 6:42 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 21, 2021 6:42 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=So many thoughtful comments here. Yes,... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F20%2Fwhat-is-the-global-public-private-partnership%2F%23comment-442536" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442536"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>So many thoughtful comments here. Yes, people (some) think and more or less see the direction of things, the writing on the wall:</p>
<p>A <strong>War</strong> (for your body and mind), and/or <strong>Slavery</strong> for ever (to a technocratic elite).</p>
<p>In 1914 people marched into a war that destroyed the lives of tens of millions… No ordinary person wanted to fight or die, yet their minds and the course of events where prescribed for them by <a href="https://www.corbettreport.com/wwi/" rel="noopener nofollow ugc" target="_blank">years of planning</a> and development of power by sociopath imperialists and militarists with global economic designs on resources. </p>
<p>Propaganda was their main tool on all sides. Any person who could see past the BS and was pacifist was considered a traitor or coward.</p>
<p>After 107 years <strong>not much has changed</strong>. The technology is more sophisticated, the power and wealth of the ruling elite (and they were never governments who are just the facilitators) are greater, their tyrannical totalitarian goals are greater, the population including the number of thinking people is greater, <strong>but</strong> the result will be the same, millions of dead, injured and suffering people. And for what, for who’s benefit? </p>
<p>Then the sheep(le) fought for king and country, their culture, their way of life, or so they were told to believe, but in the trenches they were just fighting to stay alive, to survive. But it just went on and on until 1919, took a rest and started again 20 years later, again the killing, the injuring, the suffering. We’ve had a sort of rest for 75 years (although more 10s of millions have died in power conflicts), but <strong>again we face the same evil</strong> big time.</p>
<p>Now the elite want to robotize and trans-humanize people with IA, select and genetically manipulate and generally reduce the rest of the people, with Eugenics so as to be adapted to their needs; more power, more wealth and security for themselves and their loyal minions, and to hell with the rest.</p>
<p>Perhaps people should ask themselves what really is in their own best interest, and rediscover that empathy, love, and compassion are at the root and every branch of <strong>their humanity</strong> and are what gives them the power, the strong trunk of survival, to overcome these devious forces of evil.</p>
<p>We, humanity, will only eliminate this elitist parasite when we can identify it clearly and tear it out of our own fabric, an individual and cooperative; a painful proces in itself. Now that would be a <strong>real new world</strong>.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>

Ian

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p><span>Used to think like that but not anymore.</span></p>
<p>Here are some questions: Did the Nuremberg Trials end Nazism or Fascism? Are Nazism, Fascism personal or impersonal? Are they exclusively embedded within certain individuals, the removal of whom would prevent its future surge or are these individuals the personification of something deeper and pervasive? Was the apprehension of Lee Harvey Oswald the solution that would prevent a future occurrence of the circumstances similar to those that led to the assassination of JFK? Are we against imperialists or Imperialism, psychopaths or Psychopathy? Do we aim for the root or for the symptom?</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-446150"></i></span>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-442536">
Ian
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Perhaps we should refuse to play. Why not go back to simplicity such as the Quakers have done.<br/>
Write down what’s important and live the objective you wish to obtain.</p>
<p>i.e.<br/>
(1) Health care: If you prescribe to westernized medical practices you will inevitably fail.<br/>
The pharmaceutical industry is a major contributor to the problems stated in this article. A scientific case can be made that proves vaccines are not effective.<br/>
Solution: Treat the mind, body and the soul.<br/>
Open new wellness centers that promote preventive medicine. You will have an abundance of customers. Yes and that means teaching the young and old alike. Share the wealth of knowledge that is already available starting with dietary guidelines.<br/>
And no I don’t mean the ones by the agricultural industry. Look into a plant based diet.</p>
<p>(2) Shelter: (to be continued)</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>None of the current featured articles quite fit the nature of this link from today’s globalresearch.ca. But I believe it’s so compelling that it must be shared. Not that I’m particularly anti-abortion (I believe only women should have a say in it). But this is something straight out of hell.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.globalresearch.ca/new-evidence-infanticide-creation-fetal-cell-line-used-covid-vaccine-testing/5759194" rel="noopener nofollow ugc" target="_blank">New Evidence for Infanticide in the Creation of the Fetal Cell Line Used for COVID Vaccine Testing – Global ResearchGlobal Research – Centre for Research on Globalization</a></p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>If you haven’t joined ChurhOFCOVID I suggest you pop in from time to time for some you gotta laugh for crying stuff like…</p>

<p>I know I know it is no laughing matter, but I find this stuff cathartic, as we realise there are many out there who can see this shit for what it is</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-left">
<div class="wpd-avatar">
<img alt="George Mc" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" decoding="async" height="64" loading="lazy" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5fdd943d9ddc48d0d81f2f9071aee6d4?s=64&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5fdd943d9ddc48d0d81f2f9071aee6d4?s=128&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg 2x" width="64"/>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-442489">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
George Mc
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 21, 2021 3:22 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 21, 2021 3:22 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=https://in-this-together.com/global-co... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F20%2Fwhat-is-the-global-public-private-partnership%2F%23comment-442489" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442489"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p><a href="https://in-this-together.com/global-commons-part-1/" rel="nofollow ugc">https://in-this-together.com/global-commons-part-1/</a></p>
<p>“Make no mistake, the GPPP intend to control every aspect of the Earth and our lives. That is the transformation they are working towards and they have used the pseudopandemic to set that transition in motion. <strong><em>There is no political opposition to the GPPP. They are realpolitik entire. </em></strong>All they need, for their <em>“solutions”</em> to close the trap, is our compliance.”</p>
<p>The part I have highlighted is the meat of the matter and the one aspect of this audacious covid manoeuvre which really <strong><em>ought</em></strong> to be becoming increasingly clear. And when I say “ought” I am trying very hard to project my mind into those of the covid faithful, to try and understand what the hell is going on in their skulls. Without a doubt, they will never have heard of this “GPPP” (Global Public Private Partnership). But surely they will have some concept of politics as a field of groups in opposition to each other. And surely it must have occurred to them that the media has been uniform all the way down the line since last spring. </p>
<p>Yes, there were carefully assembled “disagreements” but not one of them challenged the basic assumption about covid as the potential end-of-all-things. Nor was there any challenge to the instantly asserted claim that the vaxxes were essential to life on Earth. </p>
<p>Did these covid convinced punters ever muse on the <strong><em>lack</em></strong> of any political challenge to the covid tale? Were they so bogged down in that Leftist chant of incompetent virus management? Is it not the case that this triumphalist gloating over these fat cats getting their “viral dressing down” has a “shelf life” that must surely have elapsed by now? </p>
<p>And how much longer can they hear that “the drugs don’t work” – or that “the drugs aren’t quite right yet so we need another batch”? </p>
<p>I have heard work colleagues already expressing a deep disgust over these covid regulations – and this from within the apocalyptic paradigm. And when your own life is going down the tubes in what appears to be a relentless systematic way, how much longer can you blame “bad management”? </p>
<p>How long can everyone avoid the questions that must now be battering somewhere deep in the chambers of their minds: <strong><em>“Why is there only one story here? Why are the forces that are supposedly opposed to each other so curiously united here? Where is the true opposition?”</em></strong></p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">
<div class="wpd-vote">

</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Because it’s science and above politics. The unanimity of response proves how right it is. The extremity of the response proves how right it is.</p>
<p>That’s how the normie looks at things.</p>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442524"></i></span>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-442489">
George Mc
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>👍 And when they do ask those questions and answer them… What a painful awakening when they realise that the whole business is an attempt to salvage a system of human regimentation, not save them from a vir**; that they, as individuals, are of the least concern, if any, for those who are making the decisions!</p>
<p>A French politician said at the wake of the 20th century that – paraphrasing – Economics and Politics are too entangled matters to be treated separately, also we have the expression “Political Economy”. Note that it’s “Political Economy” and not “Economical Politics”: Economics have precedence over Politics, not the other way around. Politicians and other actors would not even exist as we know them (a parasite class) without the particular social organisation made possible through Political Economy worldwide, and so they align themselves, as they’ve always did, to whatever mandates issued by its spokesmen and spokeswomen of the WEF, IMF, WB, BIS, and so on, this time specially when the system itself is at stake.</p>
<p>And to mention Peter Daszak’s famous quote:</p>
<p>“<em>We need</em> to increase public understanding of <em>the</em> <em>need</em> for medical counter-measures such as a <em>pan</em> corona vaccine. A key driver is the media and the economics will follow the hype. <em>We need</em> to use that hype to our advantage to get to the <strong>real issues</strong>. Investors will respond if they see profit at the end of the process. [Emphasis added]”</p>
<p>I’ll bet anything that among the “real issues” he’s referring to, specially considering the text that follows, you’ll find<strong> low rates of profit and market saturation globally</strong>, nothing about health, rest assured. Also, these “real issues” need to be “fixed” (it’s always about fixing issues, never definitely solving them which can’t be afforded); it’s not Schwab’s or Gates’ or anybody else’s whim, it’s an impersonal necessity immanent within the system. That’s why my real enemy is not Schwab and Gates et al, people of flesh and blood who happen to be, in this point of history, the big cogs in the system (we are the smaller ones) and who could have been anyone of us, my real enemy is the system itself.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Very good. And i would hasten to add that they are applying exactly the same methods to their projection of the climate crisis. Which is no more than attempt to prolonge their destructive economic system for as long as they can. However, much as we are all compromised by the system, we still have the choice to work ourselves free from it and as there is no magic solution such as COP26 et al it’ll take time but that shouldn’t discourage us from starting to revolt.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-443302">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
The Coming Revolution
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 23, 2021 9:41 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 23, 2021 9:41 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=So Bill Gates wakes up one morning and... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F20%2Fwhat-is-the-global-public-private-partnership%2F%23comment-443302" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-443302"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-442953">
NixonScraypes
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>So Bill Gates wakes up one morning and without no one telling him anything, without consulting anyone, out of the blue, took it upon himself the task of vaccinating every human being on earth, making by the way a lot of money and by the same token reducing world population. Questions I’m struggling with: What about his advisers, his connections to other businessmen, his ties to the financial world, to the industry, to political figures? What about the connections to the military? What about his political, geopolitical, social, economic, even philosophical views? Did all of that have no influence on his decision making? And what made it historically possible that he is in that position so as to be exposed to that particular web of influence? I mean, it’s not enough and far from satisfactory to say that Gates is doing what he is doing because he is a psychopath: we are all alienated to some degree, so that the difference in alienation between the average Joe and an individual like Gates is only of degree, and degrees are nothing when you look historically at things; give the average Joe 50 years and the right circumstances and we’ve got a Bill Gates.</p>
<p>And suppose we arrest the lot of them, what then? Shouldn’t we, in view of the lessons of history, reasonably expect the emergence of other Gates, Soros, Schwabs, and co. in the not too far future, so what real good does that to the next generations? And doesn’t that prove that the problem doesn’t lie in the individuals but in something else? What produces alienated individuals shouldn’t be more important to think about than the individuals themselves? Here I’ve the back of R. D. Laing who believed, and his practice showed, that the causes of what we call “mental illness” are not to be found within the so called “mentally ill” but in the relationships they keep with the members of family and society at large. </p>
<p>It is my view that the crisis we’re all facing, and which didn’t start in this or last century, hasn’t at its root people of flesh and blood which are just the visible hands of an invisible and impersonal necessity inherent to the particular mode of production that is literally regimenting human life, and that impersonal necessity expresses itself through our submissive kind of relationship to things, dead things like money and the commodity.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>I read some Laing over 50 years ago when i was a neurotic teenager struggling out of my state educated situation. I seem to believe his book was “the death of the family” I think he was part of the Tavistock Institute which I now believe to be Frankfurt School, Freudian,British Empire,Globalist, Shits of the First Order. Maniac psycopathic arseholes of evil intent, masquerading as evangelists of the white hot science of the soul. I hate them with a passion. They are twisted people bent on distorting the world in their own deformed image. The means of production are created by people, in the case of the world today and yesterday, the hideously ugly,jealously destructive slave owners of us all. I think that sums it up!</p>
</div>

<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-444315">
NixonScraypes
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Agreed. It’s a fact that they are all of that you describe and much more; the only thing is I don’t believe that humanity’s problems will be solved to any satisfaction, specially considering the madness and suffering that has descended on the earth, by getting rid of them – whatever that means – without abolishing the system, for what breeds these psychopathic traits is the current system that reifies the human as if it were a commodity, where relationships between humans mimic relationships between objects, and where dead things are more important than live things.</p>
<p>So, in my view, nothing short of a radical revolution in human relationships, one that brings about fraternity among the large human family – which is how people used to define Communism in the 19th century: <em>fraternity</em> – will really do.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Sort of agreed. Knowing that these creatures exist and how they undermine fraternity is the important thing. Ein volk ein reich, they all come up with the same slogans and it ends in a bloodbath. The french revolution turned out that way and if you read the real history, it was mostly the peasants who got slaughtered. The aristocracy aligned with the financial elite took over, meet the new boss! Since the dawn of time fraternity has been blood fraternity, families, extended families, tribes, huge tribes etc. Fine words spill from the mouths of saints and murderers, psychopaths are often the most charming of men and they all advertise liberty, fraternity etc. Catch my drift?<u><span class="ql-cursor">﻿</span></u></p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-445532"></i></span>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
 Reply to 
<a href="#comment-445483">
NixonScraypes
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>I made it clear: “fraternity among the large human family”, no one excluded. I refuse to let them define what the word “fraternity” means and it’s easy to know what the etymology of the word is. And if a few people get together because their common interest is to keep a social order that evidently causes suffering to the many, then I refuse to call it a fraternity, even if that’s what they call themselves. Just as I refuse to call “communists” – living in a community – countries that use the monetary and wage systems even if that’s what they call themselves.</p>
<p>If I don’t keep a fixed principle or principles in my mind as guides, I’d better stop thinking altogether and surrender.</p>
<p>I agree with your account of the French Revolution, the new bourgeoisie and the aristocracy got together so much so that the latter accepted the republican regime when they saw that was in their interest; but I refuse call their union a fraternity.</p>
<p>Appropriating the language is part of the struggle.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442484"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Now it’s “HEALTH SECURITY”. Where the fk did that one come from ?? Here’s the fraud Javid giving it big licks with additional and more lurid doses of the tiresome fear factor. Note how Covid now sits comfortably alongside the flu and other ‘deadly’ viruses. The criminality of “cases” with a ‘test’ which is as useful as an ashtray on a motorbike continues unabated. Vomit inducing stuff such as those dedicated health professionals working so hard to keep us all “SAFE” and we won’t allow the NHS to become “overwhelmed” is truly sickening and let’s not forget the “deaths over 100 per day” stat minus any statistical analysis as to conclusive evidence that something called “Covid” is responsible. The rest is pure political cant. This scum and their agenda must be fought tirelessly in any way we possibly can.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nS9InLzXgvk" rel="noopener nofollow ugc" target="_blank">Cases could hit 100,000 a day this winter, Javid </a><a href="https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/13.0.1/svg/1f1ec-1f1e7.svg" rel="nofollow ugc">https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/13.0.1/svg/1f1ec-1f1e7.svg</a> Covid Press Conference @BBC News live <a href="https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/13.0.1/svg/1f534.svg" rel="nofollow ugc">https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/13.0.1/svg/1f534.svg</a> BBC – YouTube</p>
</div>

<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442646"></i></span>

<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-442484">
Grafter
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Political cant is MSM now. But more worryingly – it is also the published ‘science’. Because a close contact had Covid recently, I have been isolating – and I read studies about transmission to get a feel. A recent study said that they have proved that asymptomatic cases are more likely to spread asymptomatic Covid. At the end of the study, even though the study did not look at efficacy or safety, they said basically the only way forward is to v and wear masks. I’m leaving people to read between the Emperor’s New Clothes lines there. </p>
<p>I actually see the no show in Parliament this week as a good thing. Clearly they felt there was no point in a debate because their hands are tied. Sometimes you vote by absence. </p>
<p>There was a British humour in this turn of events I feel – anyone versed in Monty Python or HIGNFY or The Young Ones could see it in evidence. They made it a farce – I believe purposefully.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Everything these people say is a lie. The truth really is not in them. You can expose them and undaunted, they will come up with another lie. As long as these types are in office nothing can change. Im afraid, when the term “cases” comes up, I just see a huge pile of suite cases abandoned on a station platform, it’s that meaningless.</p>

<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">

<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Resist.  Is it a possibility that the ... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F20%2Fwhat-is-the-global-public-private-partnership%2F%23comment-442471" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>

<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442471"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Resist. Is it a possibility that the sock puppets will end up in the dock, after the numbers have been reduced, the experiment concluded? Then the the handwringing begins, the usual ”we did it with the best intentions, no bad faith at all…honest”. – and the real perpetrators will, as ever, stay in the shadows and reap the rewards, another great experiment in the great game concluded? Or are we and our children doomed and enslaved by pure evil until an inevitable and miserable end? I prefer the first option. Worth fighting for I think. Take heart.</p>
</div>

rubberheid

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>a thumbs up/doon option was easier admins – never mind the nutters, why would I post fresh when someone else has already articulated my thoughts/understanding? that’s just filling the board up with repetition, feeding the echo chamber ..<br/>
I also get any data profiling shite and the like, and the malicious downvoters…<br/>
Still, i’d have those green/red option at hand.<br/>
just a suggestion.</p>
</div>

<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-442497">
rubberheid
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>While having the knee-jerk reaction of rejecting likes/dislikes a la Facebook, I’m beginning to move over to this point of view exactly for those reasons. One, why repeat what someone has just eloquently written; and, two, within our community we can get some idea of how accepted a given opinion is, not for the narcissistic purpose of amassing up votes, but just to know where we stand in relation to others.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>👍</p>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p><a href="https://winteroak.org.uk/2021/10/20/whos-behind-the-fake-left-vaccine-gang/" rel="nofollow ugc">https://winteroak.org.uk/2021/10/20/whos-behind-the-fake-left-vaccine-gang/</a></p>
<p>Fascinating article. And it highlights one major weakness of “pro-vaccine protests”. These “protesters” are protesting against <strong><em>other</em></strong> protesters i.e. against the anti-vaxxers. Now that in itself signals a weakness i.e. a protest <strong><em>against</em></strong> a protest thus a kind of “diluted” protest.<br/>
 <br/>
Even more embarrassing: these “pro-vaccine protesters”, through this “double negative” movement, <strong><em>are in favour of what the government want to do anyway!</em></strong> It’s the WSW problem: <strong><em>These groovy rebels are in total agreement with the powers that be – but are pretending otherwise! </em></strong></p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>The pro-vaccine Left has been well prepared by conspiracy phobia – a condition which buries the directive “Follow the money!” And when I say “buries” I mean this directive is made to forcibly recede into the horizon to the point where it is banished from consciousness altogether.</p>
<p>Thus the financial roots of everything are hidden. And we have entered a flatland where perspective is impossible. It’s like embracing a schizophrenia where the world itself becomes two-dimensional, like a film screen onto which the rulers can project whatever they want. (Plato’s cave no less!)</p>
</div>

<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442467"></i></span>

<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-442453">
George Mc
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Note the poster “50 Years of Counter Power”. Note the two old guys kissing each other in the middle bottom (not <strong><em>their </em></strong>middle bottom but the middle bottom of the poster!) I haven’t seen that image before. For all I know it might be a famous image of two big gay icons or something. But I can’t help get the feeling that this, as with gay marches, is a matter of <strong><em>deliberate provocation</em></strong>. I don’t care who’s gay and who isn’t. But I’ve always been suspicious of these “Right On” demonstrations that seem to be determined to whip up “the old traditionalists”. Shouldn’t all sexual activity – being a private act – be discreet? Oh but I can imagine the protests coming from the woke crowd calling me a vile bigot who won’t celebrate this “lovely demonstration” of all kinds of sexuality. David Icke’s designation of the “Robot Radicals” becomes ever more pertinent.</p>
<p>And it’s not just a matter of two people kissing in public. Who cares about that? No, these two have been photographed and the photo placed in a prominent position in a poster as if to say, <strong><em>“Well, what do you think about this then?”</em></strong> Were it a heterosexual kiss, the matter of positional purpose would still arise.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>
