<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442428"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-442283">
susan mullen
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Hi Susan. </p>
<p>1) Energy supplies are now seriously constrained. There are – literally – no, zero sources alternative to fossil hydrocarbons anywhere near sufficient to supply our current extravagant demand. Plenty of techie-techie hallucinations, but nothing solid. And meanwhile EROEI (qv) continues on its remorseless downward progress.</p>
<p>2) Metals – particularly iron and copper ores – are already constrained, and this will get worse as new finds continue to fall short of current demands. Also, all ores require high quantities of energy to refine. See 1) above.</p>
<p>3) Pollution. One of the famous five curves of the original ‘TLTG’ study. It’s now a serious all-globe problem, causing amongst many other problems, a fall in fertility of all creatures – including humans, natch.</p>
<p>4) (bonus!) Food. Another of the five curves. Climate is now shifting. Entirely unpredictably, despite all the ‘consensus’ hallucinations of the technocrats. We simply don’t know with any – justifiable – certainty how it will go. It may get colder or warmer. We just can’t tell for sure. Part of this shifting is due to natural forcings, some cyclical, some unpredictable one-offs. Another part is due to the unprecedented pouring of CO2 into the atmosphere from our reckless burning of fossil hydrocarbons. Another one-off. This leads both to long-term changes in weather patterns, and also extreme weather events, both of which seriously disrupt food harvests.</p>
<p>Hope this will do as a small sample of all the problems to do with the growthforever delusiono. Do look into EROEI. It’s crucial.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>
<div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-like" title="0">0</div><div class="wpd-vote-result-sep"></div><div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-dislike" title="0">0</div>

<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=By fuck are they hammering this covid ... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F20%2Fwhat-is-the-global-public-private-partnership%2F%23comment-442172" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442172"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>By fuck are they hammering this covid shit now. My wife – a covidian – said in a blasé voice, “Oh looks like there’s going to be another lockdown” and, in our ensuing altercation, rattled off a figure of so many thousand who just keeled over. </p>
<p>And since we have a friend – an even more impressionable covidian – who is just recovering from a bout of covid near death etc., I am expecting a real dressing down coming up where they will demand I repent my conspiratorial ways. </p>
<p>As for myself, I just cannot believe this fucking degradingly obvious bullshit is still there and still spewing out everywhere. As Iain Davis said, if covid really was the deadly Great Evil, the media would never have had to put on the All-The-Year-Round Halloween mask and go “Boo!” Everyone would be scared as a matter of course and indeed the media would be trying to calm folk down.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-avatar">
<img alt="George Mc" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" decoding="async" height="64" loading="lazy" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5fdd943d9ddc48d0d81f2f9071aee6d4?s=64&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5fdd943d9ddc48d0d81f2f9071aee6d4?s=128&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg 2x" width="64"/>

<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-442169">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
George Mc
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 20, 2021 7:47 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 20, 2021 7:47 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Sajid Corleone makes you an offer you ... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F20%2Fwhat-is-the-global-public-private-partnership%2F%23comment-442169" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442169"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Sajid Corleone makes you an offer you can’t refuse!</p>
<p><a href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-58985617" rel="nofollow ugc">https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-58985617</a></p>
<p>“Get Covid jab or restrictions more likely, Sajid Javid says</p>
<p>Sajid Javid encourages take up of Covid boosters: <strong><em>“We’ve got the jabs, we need the arms to put them in””</em></strong></p>
<p>Interesting use of the word “encourages” there. Especially considering the palpable menace of the actual words he used. </p>
<p>“If not enough people get vaccinated, it is more likely restrictions will be reintroduced in England, the health secretary has said.”</p>
<p>Don’t you just love it! It is “more likely”? What is more likely? That “restrictions <strong><em>will be</em></strong> reintroduced” Note the passive voice. Restrictions <strong><em>will just sweep in and reintroduce themselves</em></strong>. Perhaps like Tolkien’s Ringwraiths sweeping through the shadows? Nothing to do with Sajid! </p>
<p>“Sajid Javid said he did not believe the current pressures on the NHS were unsustainable.”</p>
<p>Dangling a little bit of hope there, Sajid? Come along now! Don’t you want this, you children? Well you better do what you’re told! Because … </p>
<p>“He added that the government would not be bringing in its Plan B measures, which include mandatory face coverings and working from home, <strong><em>“at this point”</em></strong>.” </p>
<p>Know what I mean? </p>
<p>“But he warned cases <strong><em>could</em></strong> rise to 100,000 a day.”</p>
<p>It can be arranged! <strong><em>You may wake up with a horse’s head!</em></strong></p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">
<div class="wpd-vote">

</div>
<div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-like" title="0">0</div><div class="wpd-vote-result-sep"></div><div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-dislike" title="0">0</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 20, 2021 8:03 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 20, 2021 8:03 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Looks like I bailed out too soon. Look... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F20%2Fwhat-is-the-global-public-private-partnership%2F%23comment-442175" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442175"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-442169">
George Mc
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Looks like I bailed out too soon. Look at this:</p>
<p>“Mr Javid told a Downing Street news conference: “If not enough people get their booster jabs, if not enough of those people that were eligible for the original offer… if they don’t come forward, if people don’t wear masks when they really should in a really crowded place with lots of people that they don’t normally hang out with, if they’re not washing their hands and stuff, it’s going to hit us all.”</p>
<p>Now I’m trying to ease my way into the mind of a covidian and I’m trying to figure out how the murky thought processes of one such would go. It’s a bit like trying to look into the mind of one of the Walking Dead from that TV series. There’s one episode where a scientist has wired up a mind of a newly infected person to measure the brain activity. And the fireworks show that signifies normal brain function all goes dark as death strikes. But after a while there is a sinister little red glimmer that lights up at the base of the mind and zombie life has begun. I reckon that’s how the covidian mind “works”.</p>
<p>But could it be that some of those shambling automatons might start to wonder, “Hang on! We’ve already been told that this vax isn’t exactly doing the wonder it’s supposed to do! And yet they’re still hammering on at everyone to get vaxxed? So, what is it that’s going to hit us all that isn’t already hitting us when it shouldn’t be?”</p>
<p>So, could something like these thoughts be percolating in that zombiefied area of the brain?</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">
<div class="wpd-vote">
<div class="wpd-vote-up wpd_not_clicked">

</div>
<div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-like" title="0">0</div><div class="wpd-vote-result-sep"></div><div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-dislike" title="0">0</div>

</div>

<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/20/what-is-the-global-public-private-partnership/#comment-442260"></i></span>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-442169">
George Mc
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>The problem is that the over-65s are not getting boosters in sufficient numbers and this is causing some anomalies in the stats.</p>
<p><a href="https://archive.ph/iAFkc" rel="nofollow ugc">https://archive.ph/iAFkc</a><br/>
UK Telegraph<br/>
Death rates for younger people worsen since Covid vaccine rollout<br/>
Worrying trend emerges, with mortality rates for under-65s this year higher than the 10-year average for both men and women<br/>
By Sarah Knapton, SCIENCE EDITOR<br/>
20 October 2021 • 4:13pm<br/>
Death rates for younger people have worsened since the coronavirus vaccine rollout, but mortality levels for over-65s have returned to normal, creating a two-tier pandemic.<br/>
Since the start of the Covid crisis, there has been a clear distinction between the impact of coronavirus on older people and younger people.<br/>
Older, more vulnerable people have borne the brunt of the deaths, while younger, healthier, age groups have barely registered in the statistics.<br/>
However, the vaccination programme has led to a curious new pattern emerging.<br/>
Recent data from the Institute and Faculty of Actuaries (IfoA) has suggested that death rates for the over-65s are back to normal, with 2021 mortality close to the average for the last 10 years.<br/>
In contrast, for under-65s, mortality rates in 2021 are on track to surpass 2020 – and show no sign of slowing down.<br/>
For men, death rates this year are nearly nine per cent higher than the 10-year average, while for women they are nearly six per cent higher.<br/>
Experts say that for the over-65s, the big spike in deaths seen at the beginning of the year has now been offset by fewer deaths than normal in the spring and summer.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>

<a href="#comment-442299">
DaveMass

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>My understanding from these statistics is that the over-65s are currently dying from old-normal things at old-normal rates; whereas there is a significant number of under-65s who are dying from spike-protein induced strokes and heart attacks. If the over-65s don’t start rolling up for boosters, this anomalous difference will become increasingly obvious.</p>
</div>
